Bud Case.Action: Recognizes the market demand for emeralds and decisively decides to purchase all three sacks, showing awareness and confidence in the value.
Engages with the seller calmly and listens carefully to the detailed descriptions about the emeralds' origins and qualities.
Shows interest in diamonds but honestly admits he doesn't have the money right now.
Sneaks a look at the TV when his own face appears, indicating private concern or caution rather than open engagement.
Expresses interest in buying diamonds despite not having money on hand, showing awareness of opportunity and financial constraints.
Tuned out a distracting noisy TV but suddenly sharpens focus when hearing his own name mentioned in news, indicating alertness and situational awareness.
Appears stunned and surprised by seeing his own face and name on the news, possibly indicating momentary shock or distraction.
Blows smoke and stays distant from the others at the bar during a celebration.
Speaks matter-of-factly about the case without celebrating, indicating a serious and focused attitude.
Expresses a belief that the burglary is part of something bigger and plans to investigate thoroughly, showing commitment and reliability.
Analyzes the situation critically and doubts initial assumptions about the crew's organization, suggesting a bigger picture.
Proposes a clear plan for the next day to interrogate their friends to uncover more information.
Is distant and quiet while others celebrate the case progress, possibly indicating thoughtful reservation or reticence.
Throws Grace against the wall, slams his face onto the table, and twists her broken nose to force information.
Shoves Marandino off when trying to calm him down.
Violently assaults Grace, twisting his nose and cracking bone while forcing him to give a name.
Shows dedication and detailed knowledge about an inmate, indicating a serious and focused approach to his work.
Shoves Marandino off when he tries to calm him, asserting control in a tense situation.
Orders Marandino to lock the door during an aggressive interrogation, showing awareness of security and control.
Applies extreme physical violence to Grace in pursuit of information.
Determines to extract a name from a beaten suspect and succeeds at getting 'He's from Whiskey Bay'.
Conducts detailed review of Jesse Wheeler's criminal and prison record, showing thoroughness and knowledge.
Analyzes Jesse Wheeler’s incarceration history in detail and evaluates the threat level effectively.
Orders caution on radio, instructs to give space and watch backgrounds.
Confronts Jesse Wheeler with a shotgun at his head, uses harsh language threatening to kill.
Notices Jesse's resigned eyes and offers a small ease in tone by telling him to shut the car off slowly.
Lowers an agonized pregnant woman to the floor and urgently commands to call an ambulance.
Directs the cops to 'toss everything' in a Nazi-surrounded, militarized house without hesitation.
Immediately rushes to assist a pregnant woman in distress, calmly lowers her to the floor, and instructs a partner to call an ambulance promptly.
Enters a threatening environment (room decorated with Nazi paraphernalia and weapons), quickly assesses the situation, and commands to 'Toss everything,' efficiently directing the search.
Introduces himself politely with a smile to Jesse Wheeler, attempting to establish rapport.
Provides Jesse with personal information about his wife to calm him down (telling him she is en route to hospital).
Engages Jesse with a grin and casual tone while discussing cyanide; tries to establish mutual understanding.
Looks Jesse in the eyes and believes his confidence about making bond, showing trust/sincerity.
Identifies himself confidently to Jesse Wheeler, establishing authority.
Observes the fridge carefully and finds hidden vials of cyanide, showing keen attention to detail.
Engages Jesse in a conversation about the cyanide, demonstrating understanding and quick thinking.
Assesses Jesse's potential bond release realistically and accurately, indicating good judgment.
Insists there is more evidence and pushes to reopen a cold case involving a murdered minister and his wife.
Persists despite Captain Braddock's discouragement and skepticism about the strength of the case.
Pushes the investigation further by presenting additional evidence linking Wheeler to a judge's murder and a double homicide, despite initial dismissal by his captain.
Confidently connects a Ruger gun from a suspect's home to a cold case through ballistics analysis.
Keeps investigation on track, shares insight with Braddock, uses humor to connect.
Shows eagerness to leverage suspect's info, slams hand on desk in excitement.
Recognizes the significance of the suspect's calmness under extreme charges as a sign of deeper knowledge.
Formulates a strategy to set a bond price unreasonably high to prevent easy release.
Keeps the discussion focused and persuasive with superiors like Braddock.
Expresses confidence that the suspect holds key information despite limited evidence presented so far.
Responds to phone call calmly, seeks detailed information about inmate Jesse Wheeler.
Recognizes the significance of Jesse Wheeler and initiates a phone call to gather intelligence, showing knowledge and initiative.
Has books on firearms and police work stacked in his house, suggesting preparation and expertise.
Lies awake in bed reviewing information and continues phone conversation, indicating diligence and thoroughness.
Asks straightforward questions about a violent inmate situation calmly, showing pragmatic concern rather than emotional reaction.
Enters harsh isolation cell to confront a dangerous prisoner directly, indicating courage but no explicit warmth or friendliness.
Responds promptly to a violent incident, questions the guards directly to understand the situation.
Effectively secures isolation cell by ensuring door with multiple locks is engaged.
Put a gun to Jesse's head at the gas station when he was arrested.
Calmly locked Jesse alone in a stone closet with no light or amenities, denying bond with a grin.
Smiled and grinned while delivering bad news to Jesse and maintaining a controlled demeanor.
Puts a gun to Jesse's head at the gas station to establish control.
Uses evidence of guns, explosives, and cyanide in Jesse's house to deduce intent and mindset, demonstrating insight and awareness.
Calmly locks Jesse alone in a stone closet with no light or beds, showing confidence and calculated control.
Informs Jesse there is no bond after seeing the judge, effectively conveying bad news with a grin, indicating control over the situation and psychological leverage.
Opts for a careful, strategic approach to handle Jesse Wheeler, emphasizing keeping him on the street rather than testifying, showing consideration for Wheeler's situation.
Acknowledges the risks involved and readiness to 'handle' resistance from Braddock, indicating responsibility and willingness to lead under pressure.
Shows no outward friendliness or warmth in interactions; remains quiet and focused, giving orders rather than engaging sincerely or tolerantly with others.
Formulates a plan to keep Wheeler as a surface informant rather than having him testify, showing strategic thinking and risk assessment.
Confidently assures the group he will handle opposition from Braddock, demonstrating leadership and confidence.
Acknowledges the high stakes of the situation and communicates urgency and consequences clearly to the group.
Insists there's leverage and the situation 'has gotta cook a little longer' despite skepticism from Braddock.
Shows agitation and persistence in trying to find leverage in a difficult case, indicating effort but uncertain skill.
Fails to convince Braddock of his argument; Braddock points out there is no leverage and Jesse won't negotiate, suggesting Bud's judgment or assessment is flawed.
Pours himself a cup of coffee and commits to not sleeping until they find leverage, showing determination and reliability.
Watches Jesse and Lynn through the glass partition with a hard stare, remaining silent and emotionally distant.
Enters prison property room after visitation, appearing weary and worn but still present, suggesting a sense of responsibility and endurance.
Acknowledges the gravity of the situation and insists on finding leverage despite difficulty ('We need somethin' more.' 'Well we ain't sleepin' till we find it.')
Observes Jesse and Lynn from a distance with a hard stare, indicating vigilance and awareness.
Appears exhausted and disheveled ('Sleepless, wrinkled clothes') yet continues to engage, showing persistence but possibly worn down.
Gives Lynn money and a card, offers help sincerely.
Walks away after offering help without pressing further.
Offers money and a card to Lynn Wheeler, showing considerate and proactive behavior in trying to help her.
Introduces himself confidently and directly, establishing his authority as a detective.
Pours coffee for Jesse and offers it as a sign of civility despite the hostile situation.
Implements deceptive tactics to make Jesse think he is not cooperating, indicating manipulativeness rather than sincerity.
Uses a subtle tactic of offering coffee to keep the conversation casual and to avoid the impression of cooperation, indicating strategic thinking and control.
Leads the guards and orchestrates the removal of Jesse from his cell without hesitation, showing command and decisiveness.
Acknowledges the harsh realities Jesse faces and offers a chance to talk, showing concern for Jesse's fractured family.
Clarifies he dislikes what certain groups represent in the system rather than the people themselves, indicating some tolerance and nuance.
Engages in a conversation about hate and integration, expressing belief in survival through understanding and safety rather than hatred.
Responds with sarcasm to Jesse's harsh accusation about his job, possibly deflecting genuine engagement.
Clearly informs Jesse of the harsh realities he faces, including the fate of his brother and consequences for his family, demonstrating knowledge and straightforwardness.
Attempts to discuss complex social issues like race and hate pragmatically, indicating thoughtful engagement and nuanced understanding.
Appears caught off guard and slightly confused by Jesse’s abrupt and pointed questioning about hate.
Maintains calm and tries to redirect conversation with a sarcastic remark about being in prison or at the compound, showing social awareness and control.
Defends his intentions firmly, challenges Jesse's judgment, but shows protective awareness about Jesse's family situation and tries to provide insight by showing surveillance photos.
Interrupts Jesse and asserts his perspective strongly, using tough language and a confrontational tone.
Flips open a file and presents detailed surveillance photos to Jesse, showing knowledge of his situation and leverage.
Confronts Jesse confidently and challenges his narrative, demonstrating control of the conversation and situation.
Uses clear, pointed reasoning (personal warranty) to counter Jesse's objections and maintain influence.
Warns Jesse about the danger to his family and expresses himself as the only person Jesse's family has to rely on.
Offers to get the judge to allow bail so Jesse can avoid trial and work for him.
Warns Jesse about the danger to his family and presents a clear, urgent choice to either accept bond via Bud’s intervention or face trial, implying he can arrange bond and work for him.
Asks about Jesse's family, indicates concern.
Emphasizes that his word counts, implying reliability.
Demands a killing (‘I want a body’), indicating violent intentions.
Stands in the shadows, meets Jesse quietly and confidently at the shipyard to discuss serious matters, asserting his word and making clear requests.
Does not intervene publicly or show visible reaction during the judge's ruling and bail setting, choosing to observe and wait instead.
Calms down others by referring to the alligator as a 'yard dog' and telling them to relax.
Responds cooperatively and supports actions to dig where Jesse directs.
Expresses excitement and encouragement when something is found, urging others to keep working.
Maintains focus on the task and trusts Jesse's information about the timeline despite Braddock's skepticism.
Calmly identifies an alligator and defuses tension by calling it a 'yard dog'.
Nods affirmatively to Jesse's command to dig, showing trust and willingness to follow expert guidance.
Leads and coordinates the excavation enthusiastically upon finding metal drums, instructing others to clear and find edges.
Confidently counters skepticism about the evidence’s condition, stating they will get an ID because they have the perpetrator, showing insight and optimism.
Uses a long lens camera to take high-speed photos discreetly from a distance
Walks into the diner and immediately greets Braddock, showing social ease but some perplexity finding him
Stares down Fitch when Fitch boasts about his adequacy to handle the case, revealing skepticism.
Expresses concern that Jesse will be left unprotected on the street and likely to die without support.
Stares hard at Fitch and leaves abruptly after Fitch is curt to the waitress, showing intolerance for rudeness.
Stares down Fitch, signaling skepticism and confidence in assessing Fitch's claim about experience.
Clearly understands the need to protect Jesse on the street and voices concern about vulnerabilities, showing practical awareness.
His silence and confused blinking at Fitch's abstract explanation suggests some difficulty grasping bureaucratic processes quickly.
Abruptly leaves the meeting after Fitch demonstrates poor social skills (ignoring the waitress, curt responses), showing intolerance for incompetence and refusal to indulge inefficiency.
Claims to have set up the investigation with Jesse, showing initiative and a plan.
Complains about the inexperienced federal agent assigned to them and resists leadership decisions.
Expresses frustration and walks away from a disagreement instead of finding a compromise.
Shows interest and engagement when Jesse mentions the hit list, indicating attentiveness and focus.
Responds to Jesse's mention of a hit list with interest and quietly acknowledges the significance by saying 'Now we're talkin'.
No direct action or mention of warmth in this excerpt; interaction is between Lucian and Jesse.
Nods to Lynn as she boards the plane, showing quiet acknowledgment and support.
Tells Jesse 'Your family's safe now' and suggests starting work, indicating some reassurance and reliability.
Collaborates closely with Jesse, sharing info and working methodically to gather evidence against AB soldiers and their operations.
Displays focused and diligent behavior, organizing files and surveillance materials to support the investigation.
Engages in covert, possibly dangerous activities without apparent hesitation.
Works closely with Jesse, trading detailed information and taking careful notes over phone calls.
Organizes complex information by typing contacts and movements, creating detailed files and organizational charts filled with mug shots, arrest sheets, and surveillance photos.
Carefully studies and cross-references numerous sources of intelligence showing focus and diligence.
Pins AB mug shots, arrest sheets, and surveillance photos wall to wall, steps back and observes his growing case.
Argues against putting Jesse in dangerous wire operation, suggesting a less risky alternative instead.
Displays frustration towards Fitch but stays engaged in teamwork.
Argues against sending Jesse out on a wire, proposes a more strategic alternative by suggesting tapping the lawyer's phone instead.
Insists on gathering solid, actionable intelligence despite bureaucratic frustration, showing understanding of investigative priorities.
Shows some impatience or frustration but stays focused on the case, balancing caution with pressure.
Cooling his heels while phones ring and ring, not intervening or taking charge in a tense situation.
Assertively demands accountability and better communication to protect shared interests.
Angrily berates colleagues and raises his voice during a tense disagreement.
Challenges leadership and demands transparency about intelligence and inter-agency communications, showing awareness of operational failures and wanting to hold others accountable.
Becomes visibly angry, argues aggressively with superiors, and is called out for being 'over-involved' and taken off stride.
Confronts Jesse for disappearing, shows concern for his safety and emphasizes the necessity of communication to protect him.
Refuses to acknowledge Jesse’s anger and distress about the protection offered, insistently demands the list despite Jesse’s hostile reaction.
Admits to Braddock that he is losing Jesse, openly expressing frustration and worry.
Demands Braddock to push back against outsiders to gain time and control, indicating a protective stance over their operation.
Confronts Jesse decisively about missing protocol and potential flight risk, showing awareness of rules and stakes.
Acknowledges limits of his control, telling Jesse 'there is no out' and insists on getting a list, showing focus and determination.
Feels frozen in place momentarily at Jesse's malevolent stare, showing a momentary loss of confidence or hesitation.
Recognizes deteriorating situation, communicates urgency about 'losin' him' to Braddock and pushes for action.
Suggests pushing back against federal agents to get space and time, advocating strategic maneuvering.
Appears unable to prevent Jesse from leaving or calming the situation, indicating limited immediate influence.
Is identified as a cop with a mouthpiece and protected by many, which implies he is competent enough to have allies and a network.
Is marked for elimination by the antagonists due to his interference, indicating he poses a serious threat and is effective in his role.
Responds to Jesse's sudden visit with a simple greeting and does not flee or react aggressively, opening the back door calmly.
Quietly washes dishes alone late at night, indicating a humble, unassuming demeanor.
Responds calmly to Jesse's sudden arrival and warning, opening the back door immediately without panic.
Washes dishes quietly despite potential danger outside, indicating a composed, measured demeanor.
Does not exhibit overt defensive or aggressive behavior when threatened, potentially risking exposure.
Urgently calls Shepard and others to meet at the office, prepares weapons quickly and decisively for confrontation.
Signals Jesse to return inside for cover during shootout.
Fights alongside Jesse to protect each other in a violent confrontation.
Slides Jesse a .357 Python to defend himself despite Jesse's injury.
Holds his bullet-ridden partner Shepard, horrified and concerned.
Engages in intense firefight, focused on survival and defense rather than unnecessary violence.
Kills AB #4 quickly and effectively after entering the house and responds immediately to threats by ducking, scrambling, and firing when ambushed by AB #5.
Reloads and arms Jesse with a .357 Python to help him defend himself despite Jesse's injury.
Engages in crossfire with enemies, attempts to shoot at fleeing van showing persistence and tactical aggression.
Stops firing and attends immediately to his injured partner Shepard upon seeing him bullet-ridden, showing emotional presence but momentarily distracted from combat.
Moves alongside a paramedic wheeling Jesse onto an ambulance, showing presence and concern in crisis.
Insists on running the suspects immediately, demonstrating urgency and care for justice.
Stands infuriated after house search comes up empty, showing emotional investment in others' safety.
Listens silently to doctor's grim prognosis about Jesse's injury, absorbing the emotional weight without deflecting.
Does not respond to Braddock's suggestion to let go, showing stubbornness but also deep commitment.
Bud drives in dark silence, drinks from flask alone after hearing bad news
Stands alone at Shepard's funeral, dry-eyed and vacant, showing no visible emotional expression
Serious, professional engagement at crime scene, promptly orders to put a tap on the lawyer's phone line despite possible objections from Braddock
Calmly accepts keys and a squad car from Braddock and drives off silently after a mission compromise.
At the funeral, stands alone with a vacant, dry-eyed stare, showing emotional control rather than distraction.
At a crime scene, quickly processes information, identifies victim, and decisively orders a wiretap despite expected disapproval.
Enters the rehabilitation ward to check on Jesse, indicating concern.
Stares intently but waits for a cue he can't find, showing hesitation or uncertainty in communication.
Enters rehabilitation ward and attempts to manage situation by signaling 'Give us a minute, Doc.'
Stares intently in the face of confusion but 'can't find his cue,' showing hesitation and uncertainty.
Struggles to tell Jesse there is no family, shows visible emotion and apologizes sincerely before walking out.
Struggles to deliver bad news to Jesse but shows emotional restraint and sympathy.
Leaves the room quietly after conveying the difficult truth, avoiding dramatics or loss of composure.
Shouting threats at an empty chair, aggressive and violent behavior while drunk.
Wavers and eventually is overwhelmed with emotion when confronted by Cobb and Marandino, indicating vulnerability and possible trust in them.
Shows up drunk, disoriented, aggressively threatening an empty chair, causing chaos and destruction in the bar.
Holsters his gun and stops his outburst when approached by Cobb and Marandino, eventually calming down and accepting to leave.
Receives a direct order to clean up and find Jesse Wheeler, despite looking tired and presumably impaired (smelling like a distillery).
Does not intervene or display compassion while Buzz is tortured and killed.
Absence of any comforting or friendly behavior in a critical violent scene.
Buzz (Bud) screams, thrashes, and shows no counter-move or resistance except panic during Jesse's attack.
Does not provide useful information or offer any calm or strategic response when interrogated.
Is physically overwhelmed and unable to defend himself or outsmart Jesse during the confrontation.
Shakes his head in disgust at Fitch, ignores cooperation pleas, tells Fitch to get out of his way.
Keeps walking and avoids engagement despite Fitch's insistence on working together.
Interprets Jesse's arson as a deliberate message showing independence and refusal of help, implying a level of understanding and respect for Jesse's choice.
Disregards Fitch and his agents, insists on his own approach and confidence in Jesse's actions, interprets the fire as a strategic move rather than reckless behavior.
Leaves the scene despite ongoing discussions and tensions, shows decisiveness and confidence in his judgment.
Calls Fitch out on not listening and takes responsibility to bring Jesse in himself, despite conflict.
Storms off defiantly after confrontation with Fitch.
Kicks Kiersey multiple times, tortures him brutally for information, inflicts bone-breaking violence.
Leans down with a venomous smile, delivers a threat before storming off.
Finds a pager on Kiersey and threatens him directly before storming off.
Calls in on police radio while driving at high speed, coordinating location info from Marandino.
Acknowledges Marandino’s info and makes quick decisions on location and approach.
Ignores Cobb's warning about Braddock's anger and insists on dealing with it later.
No action or presence shown in this excerpt; no indication of competence.
Acts patiently and diligently while conducting surveillance, coordinating with Cobb.
Urgently instructs Cobb to come down when a lead is found.
Identifies a phone number, calls Cobb to get location info, and quickly moves to surveil the spot.
Maintains low profile surveillance of the 'Jacket' subject, following him discretely through crowded areas.
Stalls, cases the street carefully, takes in surroundings, purchases cigarettes and a newspaper to observe without drawing attention.
Lights cigarette and casually passes various stores while maintaining observation.
Pauses to stare into the dress shop window, using the reflection to observe the Jacket and men without being noticed.
Using binoculars to carefully observe the surrounding perimeter from a second-story hotel room.
Has the Colonial hotel surrounded and watches carefully through binoculars, coordinating via radio, showing control and readiness in a tense situation.
Communicates clearly and efficiently with team members about ongoing operations, shares information promptly.
Shows concern by trying to explain situation regarding Kiersey's fractured wrists.
Focuses on objective details and tactical updates without evident friendliness or emotional connection.
Monitors AB activity closely using binoculars and radio communication, identifies key players and updates Braddock promptly.
Maintains calm and control while coordinating field observations and relaying information to superiors.
Says 'I can explain--' when Kiersey arrives injured and scared, indicating possible lapse or oversight in handling the situation.
Quickly picks up a .50 caliber Burrows rifle, scopes targets through binoculars, and confidently reports target movement over radio.
Recognizes limited time window and orders Kiersey to place a call within five minutes or opportunity will be lost.
Decides to wait patiently upon Cobb's report rather than pushing for an immediate action.
Maintains vigilance and continues monitoring the situation carefully over time.
No evident impulsiveness or rash decisions despite the stalemate, showing disciplined strategic restraint.
Decides not to shoot Jesse despite orders; insists Jesse should draw fire and lead the operation, showing trust and strategic tolerance.
Decides to let Jesse go to draw fire despite Cobb's objections, showing strategic thinking and confidence.
Quickly switches weapons and takes action by running out the door after making his decision.
Orders over the radio to call local and SWAT to get the place surrounded, demonstrating situational awareness and command under pressure.
Shoots Doorman #1 to protect police officers and others, taking a deadly shot to stop incoming gunfire.
Kills AB #7 and AB #8 who are threatening his allies.

Pursues Lucian aggressively into a dangerous environment, commands to stay on the door, enters while under fire, returns fire accurately, moves swiftly through the area kicking down doors and sweeping rooms with his shotgun.
Kicks down a door and quickly neutralizes AB #12 with effective physical combat, then retrieves his gun.
Throws AB #14 into the path of AB #13's gunfire, causing AB #14 to be killed by friendly fire.
Fires once and kills AB #14 dead center, quickly and decisively.
Explodes down stairs to slam into Lucian, interrupting his shooting of Jesse.
After being shot in the shoulder, hooks trigger to stop second shot, wrestles and defeats Lucian to protect Jesse.
In a maniacal rage, beats and nearly chokes Lucian to death but stops at the last moment and lets him go; then slams on restraints to detain him.
Delivers a powerful, effective attack to incapacitate Lucian quickly.
Maintains aggressive physical control over Lucian despite injury from Lucian's claws.
Exerts lethal force but consciously restrains himself at the critical moment, showing self-control and professional judgment.
Successfully restrains and handcuffs a dangerous suspect after intense struggle.
Immediately communicates capture through radio, demonstrating procedural awareness and situational responsibility.
Could have killed Lucian but chooses not to, indicating a controlled and calculated approach rather than reckless violence.
Offers Lucian a cup of coffee during interrogation.
Leads Lucian through the city lock-up with calm and control, indicating confidence navigating the environment.
Sits silently and patiently across from Lucian in the interrogation room, showing strategic restraint and awareness.
Recognizes there's something bigger going on and reacts with a slow smile, suggesting insight and understanding of the situation.
Offers Lucian a cup of coffee during interrogation, possibly as a tactic to disarm or connect, demonstrating interpersonal skill.
